instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on to morse code sounds
threads.message:
customer sent in <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> little background on it,  they had replaced the <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> with a 330 44hps d tried to find this chip to make sure its okay but no luck.  the issue is when it turns on it turns on to E.T sounds and the speaker jumps,  it sounds really like electrical pulse's or morse code i get no beep with memory taken out just the funny sound.  i have yet to dive into the board, but thought id see if this is something worth bothering with or if there is a reason it might be doing this.
will start on it in the morning.

thanks
Nate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on to morse code sounds
threads.message: something like this would have to run off an s5 rail, I'd start there, strange problem though, your a month late for april fools
